blocks.heading: Our Phased Approach
blocks.body: Migrating to .NET 8 can be complex and expensive if not done correctly. SSW is here to guide you through a proven approach with Microsoft-certified consultants who understand the .NET ecosystem inside and out.

accordionItems.label: 1. Initial Assessment
accordionItems.content: We evaluate your current systems in a Specification Review, determining how each component aligns with .NET 8

accordionItems.label: 2. Strategy Selection
accordionItems.content: We recommend either a gradual rollout or a full upgrade, depending on your priorities and timelines.

accordionItems.label: 3. Planning
accordionItems.content:
Refactor: Update existing code to run on .NET 8.

Replace: Find a ready-made product with the functions you need.

Rewrite: Build from the ground up if no equivalents exist.

accordionItems.label: 4. Execution
accordionItems.content: Our team follows a careful migration plan that reduces downtime and keeps disruptions to a minimum.

accordionItems.label: 5. Ongoing Support
accordionItems.content: After go-live, we stay available for any tweaks and help your team settle into the new environment.

cards.heading: Choice of Migration Paths
cards.description: Whether you need a gradual Strangler Fig approach or a Big Bang migration, we'll help you choose and execute the right strategy for your system's complexity.

cards.heading: Multi-Industry Experience
cards.description: From financial services to entertainment, we've helped companies like Commonwealth Bank, Allianz, and Event Cinemas modernize their .NET applications.

cards.heading: Mobile & Cross-Platform Ready
cards.description: Leverage your .NET 8 upgrade to extend into mobile apps using React Native, Xamarin, or Flutter with our cross-platform expertise.

cards.heading: Collections in .NET: The Performance Deep Dive You Didn't Know You Needed ðŸš€
cards.description: Think you know .NET collections? Think again. From array memory layouts to dictionary collision handling, Anton Polkanov breaks down the nitty-gritty details that separate good code from great code.

cards.heading: Breaking Down .NET Aspire: Your Gateway to Cloud Native Apps
cards.description: SSW's Matt Wicks teams up with Octopus Deploy's Rob Pearson to demystify .NET Aspire. Dive into real-world orchestration, service integration, and deployment strategies that'll level up your cloud-native game.

cards.altText: Full-Stack Clean Architecture: The Right Way to Share Code
cards.heading: Full-Stack Clean Architecture: The Right Way to Share Code
cards.description: Stop wrestling with UI and API code! Matt Goldman (author of .NET MAUI in Action) reveals how to nail Clean Architecture across MAUI and ASP.NET Core without the classic pitfalls. Expect real demos, not just theory.
